[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

info vis
                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
A beautiful crystal fountain, topped with the statue of King Rathanus the First, resides at the center of the plaza square. Water sprays from the king's open mouth and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular marble tiled pool. The fountain, a tribute to the founding ruler of Rathan, symbolizes Rathanus granting the breath of life to the once barren mountain side. Luminous crystal street lanterns, gilded marble benches, and delicately pruned rose bushes surround the perimeter of the square. Located at the very heart of the city, the plaza serves as a focal point for both business and casual interactions.

                                    Visualization #2 is:
Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
An abundant gallery of paintings depicting sacrifices and hold offerings to their god suspend from crooked iron nails. Resting beside each painting, cold black iron braziers appear to hold burned blood and bone. A few charred, blackened pieces can be found in them. Several iron chains hang along the walls of the sacrificial chamber. Along the floor, intricately placed colored slate tiles are coated in dust covered dried blood. Centering the room is a raised platform accessible through a flight of stairs. Upon this raised formation rests an altar inlaid with rows and rows of teeth. 

Your active visualization is #1

Draclaw looks like a 6'9" standard young heavy boned, very muscular bodied Leuian.
He has shoulder length, wild, coarse bluish black fur, with golden eyes, and looks razor-sharp.
He appears to be unconcerned right now.
He bears the mark of Odarous.
He can be attacked by other players.
He appears to be in perfect health.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.

[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth west...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

Mashema plays bing bing on her beautiful ornate gold glockenspiel.
  A simple performance, but shows potential.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

Mashema says to Lilyth, "how I get better if I not try"

You follow Lilyth through an open stone gate...

[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. A multi-colored stained glass window peers watchful from the crafty western building.  A rotting oak sign, a closed ugly rotting door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth through an intricately carved oak door...

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth northeast...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth northeast...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Khalifa the Noble Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Lilyth through an open iron gate...

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st servant.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.

You follow Lilyth southeast...

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth southeast...

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dark cloaked city watchman, the 2nd dark cloaked city watchman, and the 3rd dark cloaked city watchman.

[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

Lilyth looks like a 1'8" standard adolescent delicate boned, slender bodied Secian.
She has very long, curly, medium golden blonde hair with fragrant flowers, almond shaped ruby red eyes, and looks translucent.
She appears to be confused right now.
She bears the mark of Sa.
She can be attacked by other players.

On her back is a pair of glimmering, gossamer wings bedecked with hundreds of tiny sapphires and diamonds that playfully catch and reflect back light.

On her chest over her heart is a tattoo of a tiny glimmering heart with a keyless lock, inscribed with faded writing.

On her ankle is a tattoo of a luminous flame embracing a slumbering sapphire Dragon.

She appears to be in perfect health.
There is a shining gold emblem affixed to her clothing.

Physical appearance:

with flushed cheek, she shimmers slightly through warm rippling air

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

The difference between night and day is minimal, only measurable in degrees of darkness. As you realize that there are eyes peering at you, following your every move, the urge to keep moving along is almost overwhelming.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dark raven.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast southwest* northwest.

You follow Lilyth northwest...

[Dark Forest]

You sense movement all around you, yet you cannot make out the shapes of what lingers in the shadows.  Only occasionally do you glimpse the red, beady eyes that you feel sure are sizing you up.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north northeast southeast* northwest.

You follow Lilyth northwest...

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east southeast*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Dark Forest, Spring]

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st twisted forest spirit.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east south west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east southeast southwest west*.

Mashema asks, "bardic recital?"

[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east southeast* southwest west.

[Dark Forest, Spring]

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring and a sharpened dried bamboo stake are here.

The area brightens.
[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms, a crooked crumbling stone bridge, and an open cheap cloth bag are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* southeast.

In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north southeast* southwest northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Mashema the Leuian.
Obvious paths: east* southeast southwest west.

[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Mashema the Leuian.
Obvious paths: east* southeast southwest west.

The area brightens.
[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Mashema the Leuian.
Obvious paths: east southeast* southwest west.

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Dark Forest]

The trees here are quite different from those that are thriving in the rest of the forest.  The long, leafy branches hang so low that they almost form a wall, blocking your view of anything nearby. [Dark Forest, Mossy Grotto]

The wall of leaves to the southeast seclude this grotto from the rest of the forest, yet they are still the easiest way in and out of here, since a sturdy wall prohibits you from making any further progress to the northwest.  A large stone in one wall appears to have some etchings in it, but is so weathered and so covered in white moss that the markings are now indecipherable.  A mossy stone wall and an opening in the wall are here.

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Mashema the Leuian.
Obvious paths: east south* west.

>[Docks.]

>[Docks.]

Mud and muck cover the roadway and pier, testament to the high traffic in the area. Men and women unload large cargo ships. Enormous quantities of food come into the city from the docks, and many other goods besides. Goods are moved into the city via the new trade road to the northwest. A pile of lumber stands nearby for future improvements.  A black wooden walkway, an open small oak crate, and an open small oak crate are here.

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. [Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention. [Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, and an empty small vial of madness cure are here.

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. >[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

[Bazaar Path.]

[Food Way.]

At this intersection many stands display their exotic foodstuffs. Hanging from large hooks are various unidentifiable hunks of meat, and vegetables of all shapes and colors. The only thing more prevalent than the merchants and buyers are the bugs, who clamor to find the most pungent item to land on. >[The Bazaar.]

A long wooden stall is set here between the Bazaar path and the large barracks which house the Spurian guard. Hanging from the front of the rickety wooden roof are furs of every type. The merchant inside is rumored to give good prices for pelts, hides, and animal parts.  A tanned leather sign, an open sturdy fur-lined stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north east*.
n
>[The Bazaar.]

A new stall has been hastily constructed on this site, in the shadow of the large Spurian Wall. Most chose to build well within the Bazaar as opposed to this outer path. Low-grade wood and bent nails make up this sorry excuse for a business establishment. A small sign on the front has a crude picture of a key on it, and the name, "Skugz."  A crooked wooden sign, a weathered dark wooden stall, and a broken street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Locksmith.]

A heavy odor of unwashed sweaty bodies assails you as you enter this rickety establishment. A short Go-blin-al scurries around in the shadows behind the counter. A variety of keys hang behind his counter, establishing this as a locksmith shop. He mumbles, as if to himself, "Heehee ... chests! Lots chests ... yeeees ... picky picky picky! Hee hee! Me unlock 'em, yeeees ... hee hee!"  A faintly glowing cup of Psycian tea is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious exits: None.

[Bazaar Path.]

Two large Oog-ra guards refuse to allow anyone to continue south. With loud gestures and over exaggerated pointing, they send wagons to the east or back north. With some slapping of backs, and happy grins, they congratulate themselves on following directions. A yell is heard from the south as Skugz screams, "Keep meee dooor clear...yes yeees...keep it clear." It is a wonder that he hasn't figured out they are turning away his customers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* east*.

You follow Mashema north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A slinky dressed female San Elf preens and giggles garnering the attention of several humans leaning out the window of the guards' quarters. Catcalls and whistles abound as she shows more thigh then is warranted. A wagon driver, distracted by the view, almost drives into a cart coming the opposite direction. Shouts are exchanged and fists shaken, as the San female snickers at all those involved.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st street harlot.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foul odor of something that can be almost described as rotted corpses floats in from the east. You hear the cart drivers murmuring something about not eating the pressed cabbage, regardless of how good it tastes. They quickly point to the long line and the overflowing outhouse and wave their hands in front of their faces.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path follows the line of the Spurian Wall. High above you can hear orders being barked and guards marching in rhythm. The closeness of the wall to the path has essentially blocked any breeze that might waft through the area. The stagnant air holds in the smells of food, incense and lots of bodies. It is not unusual to see the cart drivers with triangles of cloth pulled up over their nose and mouths.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* south*.

You follow Mashema east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Several large carts head west, full of various items the owners are sure will sell for a decent profit. Empty carts, the sign of a prosperous day, head east. An old Thugian pulls and pushes a very stubborn donkey. Neither end seems to be cooperating with his demands. Two small children dance around the Thugian and the donkey, chanting and singing a nasty song. Quickly, he takes out a switch, which is enough encouragement for both the donkey to move and the children to run.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Mashema east...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foot traffic on Bazaar Path turns south down a small trail into the heart of the Bazaar. Many of the smaller carts follow the buyers and merchants to avoid the conflicts with the larger wagons that continue west. The shouting up ahead quickens the pulse of even the most experienced seller.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* south west*.

You follow Mashema east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Deep, muddy ruts mar the road. A trickle of water flows from an unknown source creating a horrid hazard. Drivers curse one another for holding up the flow of traffic. Merchants and buyers carefully pick their way around the hold up, attempting to carefully navigate the slippery ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Mashema east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path makes a sudden left hand turn, following the direction of the large Spurian Wall. Carts and wagons creak in protest as their heavy loads shift precariously.  Waiting for that rare item to fall from one of the merchant carts, several small Flerian children play in the dust at the side of the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasion exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Mashema south...

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.

You follow Mashema west...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Mashema west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
In the area are Orlando the Noble Human, Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Side Street.]

A new building has been erected on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Symher's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.  A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.

[Spurian Trading Post.]

Symher the Usil Trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.  A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Mashema through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Mashema through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.

An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a bright wooden sign, and a Psycian star patterned porcelain jug are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Alastrine the Novice Human, Mashema the Leuian, Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone), and Shinobi the Novice Human.
Obvious exits: None.

[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a bright wooden sign, and a Psycian star patterned porcelain jug are here.

This room is illuminated.

Obvious exits: None.

You follow Lilyth through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

Lilyth giggles.

You follow Lilyth through a marble archway...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Lilyth north...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Lilyth north...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Mahlen the Human, Draclaw the Leuian, Kinson the San Elf, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: west*.

You follow Lilyth through an open stone gate...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious exits: east* west*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

Yinnin just entered from the east.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

Renalk just entered from the southwest.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast*.

You follow Lilyth through an open stone gate...

[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. A multi-colored stained glass window peers watchful from the crafty western building.  A rotting oak sign, a closed ugly rotting door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth through an intricately carved oak door...

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious exits: None.

Mashema steps onto the pathway of flames and vanishes in a fiery flash!

Lilyth hums softly.

Lilyth grins.

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. A multi-colored stained glass window peers watchful from the crafty western building.  A rotting oak sign, a closed ugly rotting door, and a street lantern are here.

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Mashema northeast...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Draclaw the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.
