[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, and an open enchanting lionskin pouch are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. >[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Kandil the Leuian, Draclaw the Leuian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, and an open enchanting lionskin pouch are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Fiora the Noble Psycian, Altayr the Anthian, Draclaw the Leuian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), Kinson the San Elf, Lothar the Noble Hithual, Ariadne the Leuian, Mashema the Leuian, Yinnin the Noble Leuian, Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone), Khalifa the Noble Leuian, and Methoss the Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, and a closed weathered burlap sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Amabel the Noble Secian, Fiora the Noble Psycian, Ronan the Hithual, Kandil the Leuian, Sull the San Elf, Mahlen the Human, Sindelle the San Elf, Amedeo the Drake, Altayr the Anthian, Yaquah the Human, Draclaw the Leuian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), Ariadne the Leuian, Devan the Psycian, Mashema the Leuian, Yinnin the Noble Leuian, Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone), Khalifa the Noble Leuian, Jiri the Flerian, and Methoss the Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed worn bearskin sack, an open enchanting lionskin pouch, and a closed weathered burlap sack are here.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Amabel the Noble Secian, Mashema the Leuian, and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern, some charred foliage, and an empty pale blue glass bottle are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Caylith the Drake (flying 5 feet above you, an eagle upon her left shoulder) and Lilyth the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a broken small canvas backpack, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed worn bearskin sack, an open enchanting lionskin pouch, and a closed weathered burlap sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Fiora the Noble Psycian, Kraatarackk the Noble Arachnian, Yaquah the Human, Ariadne the Leuian, Altayr the Anthian, and Methoss the Drag-al.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. [Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood. [Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them. >[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Sull the San Elf.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

w
>[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.

w
w
w
>[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
go gate
You cannot move in that direction.
w
[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
w
w
w
w
>[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
w
w
[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.
[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond.  An open carved rosewood door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
w
>[Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. Wall road stretches to the south, a wide passage between the city wall and several large buildings.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south.

>[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, a street lantern, and a damaged bronze bastard sword are here.

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
sw
[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

>[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Temple Sa.]

After the world abruptly shifts around you, you stand in the entrance hall to the temple of Sa. On the ceiling, a massive golden Dragon spreads its wings and flies above you. s
>[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. When the build-up becomes strong enough, small bolts of lightning rapidly circle the altar. Feverish drawings of rune symbols blanket the walls from floor to ceiling in frantic crimson patterns.  An altar, a large dragon etched crystal offering bowl, a glowing blue ruby orb on a gold pedestal, a blue vellum treatise on Saian dogma, and some ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east* west*.
e
>[Temple Sa.]

Massive bookshelves line every conceivable inch of wall within this gigantic chamber. Although a few desks are scattered about, the collection of books has left little room for anything else. Most of the books are open to the public for reading and study, while others are kept locked in vaults for use by only the most powerful mages. Anyone else attempting to read them would surely go insane.  A closed giant glass case of Saian artifacts is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
w
>[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. w
>[Temple Sa.]

Burn marks cover the walls of this chamber, apparently the result of spells gone awry. Here and there a trainer works with younger members of the temple, teaching them to use their magick, prayers, and skills to serve Sa. Some of the more accomplished members of the temple have given breathtaking performances in this room, showing novitiates the wonders of Sa.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st battle cat (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar).
Obvious exits: east*.

help pray

Command name: pray

Description
-----------
PRAY allows you to ask your deity for a miracle.
Common prayers include HEAL, HIDE, STRENGTHEN, SANCTUARY.
NOTE: You must have sufficient favor with your god if you want your prayers to be heard, and gods do not listen to every prayer.

Syntax
------
PRAY <deity> <prayer> <target>

Examples
--------
PRAY Set hide me
PRAY Elindale heal Gaumont
PRAY Taath sanctuary me

[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. When the build-up becomes strong enough, small bolts of lightning rapidly circle the altar. Feverish drawings of rune symbols blanket the walls from floor to ceiling in frantic crimson patterns.  An altar, a large dragon etched crystal offering bowl, a glowing blue ruby orb on a gold pedestal, a blue vellum treatise on Saian dogma, and some ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Caylith the Drake (seated, an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Lilyth the Noble Secian (seated and holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious exits: north* east* west*.

Raptorian looks like a 1'7" standard adolescent average boned, wirey-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
He has short, wild, wispy light brown hair, with ruby red eyes, and looks casual.
He appears to be confused right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his back are wings fringed with small blue rubies.

He appears to be in perfect health.

[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. When the build-up becomes strong enough, small bolts of lightning rapidly circle the altar. Feverish drawings of rune symbols blanket the walls from floor to ceiling in frantic crimson patterns.  An altar, a large dragon etched crystal offering bowl, a glowing blue ruby orb on a gold pedestal, a blue vellum treatise on Saian dogma, and some ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.

In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Mashema the Leuian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).

[Temple Sa.]

The air around you crackles as you enter the central chamber of the temple. Strongly charged with energy, a massive altar with the symbol of Sa carved upon the top sits in the center of the chamber. When the build-up becomes strong enough, small bolts of lightning rapidly circle the altar. Feverish drawings of rune symbols blanket the walls from floor to ceiling in frantic crimson patterns.  An altar, a large dragon etched crystal offering bowl, a glowing blue ruby orb on a gold pedestal, a blue vellum treatise on Saian dogma, and some ruby ashes are here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed flowery bag, an open worn bearskin sack, an open weathered burlap sack, and an open enchanting lionskin pouch are here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed flowery bag, an open worn bearskin sack, an open weathered burlap sack, and an open enchanting lionskin pouch are here.

l
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, a short iron dirk, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed flowery bag, an open worn bearskin sack, an open weathered burlap sack, and an open enchanting lionskin pouch are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Vycous the Noble Frontacian, Ronan the Hithual, Sull the San Elf, Mashema the Leuian, Lothar the Noble Hithual's lifeless body, Sindelle the San Elf, Mael the Thugian, Rokayas the Anthian, Treyfalgar the Noble San Elf, Slade the Psycian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Osire the Noble Hithual, Yinnin the Noble Leuian, Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone), Khalifa the Noble Leuian, Methoss the Drag-al, and Haberthan the Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

l
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed flowery bag, an open worn bearskin sack, an open weathered burlap sack, an open enchanting lionskin pouch, and a dead grey mouse are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Draffut the Drake, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Vycous the Noble Frontacian, Jamien the San Elf, Sull the San Elf, Mashema the Leuian, Sindelle the San Elf, Mael the Thugian, Rokayas the Anthian, Treyfalgar the Noble San Elf (seated), Slade the Psycian, Alastrine the Novice Human (a raccoon upon her left shoulder), Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Rektger the Noble Arachnian, Lucas the Human, Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone), Khalifa the Noble Leuian (seated), and Haberthan the Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, and a dead grey mouse are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st delicate iridescent bluebird (wearing a small gold collar).

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, and a dead grey mouse are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raccoon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Vycous the Noble Frontacian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Sull the San Elf, Jiri the Flerian, Sindelle the San Elf, Rokayas the Anthian, Treyfalgar the Noble San Elf, Slade the Psycian, Balearic the Monitanian (holding a glowing lantern), Alastrine the Novice Human (a raccoon upon her left shoulder), Osire the Noble Hithual, Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Rektger the Noble Arachnian, Lucas the Human, Khalifa the Noble Leuian, Methoss the Drag-al, and Haberthan the Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman corpse.
In the area are Kayin the Human (seated) and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth east...

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
shiv

You follow Lilyth through an elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Balearic the Monitanian (holding a glowing lantern), and Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Lilyth through an open iron gate...

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

You follow Lilyth southwest...

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.

You follow Lilyth southeast...

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth southeast...

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Lilyth south...

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. [Noble Way.]

[Noble Way.]

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed. A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. >[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

[East Trade Road.]

A wooden signpost gives the directions and distances to the two closest cities. The arrow leading west is denoted as Spur, while the one directing east states Caersech. Next to the signpost rests an elderly druid amidst a cushion of moss, leaves, and flower petals. [East Trade Road.]

A hedge of spiky brambles forms a natural division from the lands and the swampy terrain to the south. Tall, limbless trees dot the horizon there, their bases lost in the misty depths of the gases hovering over the waters. Now and then a strange, growling sound echos up to the north, or an odd, high-pitched call of some unseen crow, probably feasting on a fallen creature hidden in the mists. The path curves away from the sounds, as popular choice has preferred to travel around the edges, rather than through the marshy sludge.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Lilyth the Noble Secian (holding a glowing fiery ruby sorcerer's stone).
Obvious paths: northeast west*.

You follow Lilyth northeast...

[East Trade Road.]

The open plains are becoming scattered with scraggly trees, the wood of which proving inefficient to use for building as the elements of nature have grown the trunks so twisted and hard in order to withstand the onslaughts of time. Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

This area is illuminated.

A sudden shift in the wind brings forth the sullied aroma of death and decay from the swamp southern lands. Slurpish noises belie the path of some creature traveling through the muddy scape, their movements hidden behind the smoky mist that reduces visibility to a mere few feet past the swamp's edge.

[East Trade Road.]

Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.

This area is illuminated.

Stepping near the orb to investigate closer only causes it to again blink out of existence, forming once more, deeper into the mists. It soon becomes apparent that the mysterious lights are attempting to slyly lead you into the swamp. To or for what purpose, is the question.

                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
A beautiful crystal fountain, topped with the statue of King Rathanus the First, resides at the center of the plaza square. Water sprays from the king's open mouth and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular marble tiled pool. The fountain, a tribute to the founding ruler of Rathan, symbolizes Rathanus granting the breath of life to the once barren mountain side. Luminous crystal street lanterns, gilded marble benches, and delicately pruned rose bushes surround the perimeter of the square. Located at the very heart of the city, the plaza serves as a focal point for both business and casual interactions.

                                    Visualization #2 is:
Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
An abundant gallery of paintings depicting sacrifices and hold offerings to their god suspend from crooked iron nails. Resting beside each painting, cold black iron braziers appear to hold burned blood and bone. A few charred, blackened pieces can be found in them. Several iron chains hang along the walls of the sacrificial chamber. Along the floor, intricately placed colored slate tiles are coated in dust covered dried blood. Centering the room is a raised platform accessible through a flight of stairs. Upon this raised formation rests an altar inlaid with rows and rows of teeth. 

Your active visualization is #3

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, and a gilt framed painting on the wall are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[New Treehaven Bank]

The smell of freshly cut lumber fills the large lobby of the newly finished bank.  The roof is a collage of intertwined branches and their leaves from above, with a delicately crafted wooden lattice frame set with glass panels just beneath.  The trunk of the Mother tree serves as the back wall of the bank, with the tellers sitting at booths just in front of it.  Some freshly crafted wooden stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go st
>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

The platform has been swept recently, revealing the new boards that have replaced some of the burned ones.  The remains of the old bank to the south have been completely cleared away, leaving just the shell of the old building there.  Intricately crafted stairs lead from the platform to the new building that resides in the upper branches.  An open door and a freshly painted wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* west*.
go door
>[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, and a gilt framed painting on the wall are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go ste
go ste
>[Steps.]

A great deal of the forest is visible between the ornately crafted columns of the spiraling staircase. Directly below, the damage from the recent fire is very evident.  Further away, however, the lush forest spreads out and reminds one of the greatness of the Caersech.  Some steps circling the tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
go ste
>[Steps.]

The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted.  The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. The view of burned trees and the scorched structure of the fallen inn spoils the otherwise wondrous scene.  Some steps circling the tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
[Hope's Path.]

Contrasting starkly with the ashes of the forest and brush is a freshly constructed set of stairs that wraps itself about the large tree. The intricate woodwork that decorates the steps is of the finest quality, as if in parody to the blackened destruction of the hedges and brambles around the base of the trunk. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, and some clover shaped stones are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north east south west.

>[5 sec. delay]

>It's too dark to see anything!  Ready a torch.

l
The area brightens.
>[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast east* southwest northwest.
nw
>[Hope's Path.]

A small path, its stones in the shape of four leaf clovers, winds its way through the sparse remains of a once dense undergrowth. Blackened limbs crunch underfoot beneath piles of moist, newly fallen leaves.  A small winding stone pathway and a broken and cracked steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southeast* southwest.
n
ne
>[Hope's Path.]

A fine haze of dust hovers over the remains of the Silver Owl Inn. Through the fallen timbers and memories of lives lost, one can see brilliant green sprouts reaching for sunlight. A tiny songbird perches on an old stick of furniture poking through the rubble, singing sweetly to herald new life and hope. A small winding path of stones placed in the shape of four leaf clovers winds itself through the forest.  A small winding stone pathway and a charred ancient steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast south* northwest.
>[Caersech Forest.]

Young shoots of new growth stand in stark contrast the otherwise barren forest ground around the path. A handful of wildflowers and other weeds poke about the fallen trunks of a pair of brunt trees.  Some colorful wild flowers, some long green weeds, and a freshly painted directional sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southwest* west.
n
>[Caersech Forest.]

Small wildflowers and large tufts of grass cover the ground around the well-worn path that winds across the forest floor. A number of young saplings sprout eagerly from the ground around the remains of a once tall maidenhair. Standing beside the path is the Merchant's Pavilion, nestled comfortably among the brush.  An open pine door, a large green silk tent, and some colorful wild flowers are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast south* west.
go door
>[Treehaven Pavilion.]

The smell of fresh-cut pine fills your nose as you enter the building.  Fresh boughs hang from rafters that are not too far above your head, lending their scent to keeping the pavilion smelling fresh. The majority of the building is taken up by a commons area of packed dirt in the center where customers and merchants alike can see what is being bought and sold all around.  An open blackened pine door and an open elegant carved rosewood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* west northwest*.
nw
>[Treehaven Pavilion, Delania's.]

Weapon racks, armor stands, display cases; something involving weapons and armor cover nearly every free space of the floor. Amidst the pile of equipment a crowded sales counter takes up a considerable portion of the northern wall. A young Firian mans the counter, hastily eating a sandwich in between customer transactions. Out of sight, a female voice mutters loudly, "Where will everything fit?"

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* southeast* south.

n
[Treehaven, Main Platform]

New wooden planks fit side by side creating the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic, despite the burnt spikes of trees in the midst. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or put there by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. Mysterious symbols are scattered throughout the portraits, which shimmer with a golden whisper as they are approached.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* northwest*.
[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Delicately crafted latticework serves as the railing opposite the recovering Mother tree. An arching bridge spans the gap between the platform and the walkway residing against the tree to the north.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southeast* west*.
[Treehaven, Oaken Bridge.]

Finely carved oak filigree lines the top edges of the oaken beams that serve as railing for the wooden bridge. Carvings of young firian maidens stand upon the the ends of the handrails, decorating the walkway that spans the platforms between the Northern Tree and Mother Tree. The view of the surrounding forest is breathtaking.

This area is illuminated.

>[Treehaven, Oaken Bridge.]

Finely carved oak filigree lines the top edges of the oaken beams that serve as railing for the wooden bridge. Carvings of young firian maidens stand upon the the ends of the handrails, decorating the walkway that spans the platforms between the Northern Tree and Mother Tree. The view of the surrounding forest is breathtaking.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
se
>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Delicately crafted latticework serves as the railing opposite the recovering Mother tree. An arching bridge spans the gap between the platform and the walkway residing against the tree to the north.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west*.
go st
[Treehaven, Main Platform]

New wooden planks fit side by side creating the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic, despite the burnt spikes of trees in the midst. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or put there by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. Mysterious symbols are scattered throughout the portraits, which shimmer with a golden whisper as they are approached.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* northwest*.
[Elindale's Temple.]

This is the main entrance of a Temple of Elindale, the inside walls perfectly smooth with glowing magickal symbols upon the surfaces. The enormity of this tree becomes apparent as one travels up the stairs to the northwest. The air holds a fresh, new ambiance, pleasantly scented with sweet sap and rich, earthly undertones.  Some glowing magickal symbols and a brown oak staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northwest*.
nw
>[Elindale's Temple.]

Encircling the innards of this tree, these steps coil clock-wise to the top, the entire environment one single living thing. There are no cracks, no signs of building. Tapestries on the wall appear life-like, suspended with no visible attachments.  A breathtaking tapestry is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast*.
ne
se
sw
>[Elindale's Temple.]

A diminutive niche in the wall provides shelter to a small family of flying squirrels. Just inside sit the young, comfortably settled into the soft bedding the parents have gathered up. A breeze carries their tiny chitters to your ears, revealing that the niche is somehow connected to the outside world as well.  A niche in the wall is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest*.
nw
[Elindale's Temple.]

A large tapestry lines the outside wall of the passageway, most impressive in that it is not made of fabric, but of vines as tiny as thick hairs, growing in a weave. The delicate shadings of the plants is perfectly natural, and as the eye becomes unfocused, a picture of a diminutive, beautiful maiden sits amongst a foresty background. The wall opposite of this magnificent tapestry is lined with portraits of prominent temple leaders, the colors vibrant, bringing a life-like sense to the frames. The eyes of the maiden in the tapestry seem to follow you, staring directly as you pass, boring into your soul.  A vellum portrait, a canvas portrait, a suede portrait, some unfinished portraits, and a carefully painted silk screen are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southwest* northwest*.
[Elindale's Temple.]

You feel at peace and at ease with the warmth and love of Elindale that surrounds you.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
[Elindale's Temple, Altar Room.]

The hum of busy bees and hummingbirds add a tone of unity to the soft chants of the priests and murmurings of those here to offer up the sacrifices and tithes to the great Goddess, Elindale. Several monks wearing floor length robes sit in silence, with the occasional clasped hands rising up in a particularly vibrant part of prayer. The altar itself is composed of growing flowers, the tiny buds enclosing gems and gold alike. Around the base of the altar grows a ring of mushrooms, vibrantly cloaked in red with white spots dotting the umbrellas.  A healthy blooming altar of flowers and a red and white ring of mushrooms are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.
info rel
donate dec to Elindale the Lady
>
You are a Charitable follower of Elindale.

You have earned 2363 favors.

You are Balanced within your Orderly alignment.

>You kneel and make your offering to Elindale!
Your pearl and gold decanter vanishes!

>You find something suitably reflective and gaze into it...

You look like a 1'2" standard adolescent delicate boned, wirey-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
You have very long, wild, kinky white hair with a white streak, heavy lidded pale red eyes, and look disheveled.
You appear to be worried right now.
You can be attacked by other players.

On her breast is a small crescent shaped birthmark.

On her neck is a purple marked tattoo of the house of Mandor.

On her belly is a tark tribal circle around the navel.

On her back are glimmering deep Hyacinth wings with draconic runes in Golde upon them.

You appear to be in perfect health.
There is a shining gold emblem affixed to your clothing.

Physical appearance:

You see an ageless, tymless, spryte with long wild kinky whyte hair with a glowing whyte streak and sleepy eyes...

>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

The platform has been swept recently, revealing the new boards that have replaced some of the burned ones.  The remains of the old bank to the south have been completely cleared away, leaving just the shell of the old building there.  Intricately crafted stairs lead from the platform to the new building that resides in the upper branches.  An open door and a freshly painted wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* west*.

>[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, and a gilt framed painting on the wall are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a dead grey mouse, a short iron dirk, and a short iron dirk are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Zachery the Hithual, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Lthe the Leuian, Draffut the Drake, Kanae the Noble Usil Elf, Sindelle the San Elf, Mael the Thugian, Rokayas the Anthian, Reilk the Noble Flerian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Bethany the Noble Psycian, Osire the Noble Hithual, Driag the Penthanian, Methoss the Drag-al, Teef the Noble Human, and Haberthan the Hithual.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[New Treehaven Bank]

The smell of freshly cut lumber fills the large lobby of the newly finished bank.  The roof is a collage of intertwined branches and their leaves from above, with a delicately crafted wooden lattice frame set with glass panels just beneath.  The trunk of the Mother tree serves as the back wall of the bank, with the tellers sitting at booths just in front of it.  Some freshly crafted wooden stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Leaves and small twigs spot the walkway as it hugs against the trunk of the Mother Tree. New sprouts from the branches above hang softly over the wooden planks, shading it slightly. A large building rests gently against the trunk in the limbs above, nestled as though it grew from within the tree itself.  An oak ladder is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.
n
>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

New wooden planks fit side by side creating the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic, despite the burnt spikes of trees in the midst. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or put there by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. Mysterious symbols are scattered throughout the portraits, which shimmer with a golden whisper as they are approached.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* northwest*.
nw
>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Delicately crafted latticework serves as the railing opposite the recovering Mother tree. An arching bridge spans the gap between the platform and the walkway residing against the tree to the north.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southeast* west*.

>[Treehaven, Oaken Bridge.]

Finely carved oak filigree lines the top edges of the oaken beams that serve as railing for the wooden bridge. Carvings of young firian maidens stand upon the the ends of the handrails, decorating the walkway that spans the platforms between the Northern Tree and Mother Tree. The view of the surrounding forest is breathtaking.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.

A small wooden landing clings to the large tree trunk of the Northern Tree. A large wooden ramp leads down the main platform to the south. [Treehaven, Small Landing]

A very small landing rests in the branches of this slowly returning tree. Access to the Northern Tree to the west and more construction in the trees to the east is purely by ropes and vines stretches between them.  A large pile of lumber sits in one corner of this landing, resting here before it gets carted over and used in the work to the east.  A vine bridge and a rope bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. [Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, a snow angel, a pile of snow, and a riverboat are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southwest.

You are now at 10 feet.

>[Riverboat.]

Lined with wooden seats, this slim oak boat looks to be able to carry its passengers relatively quickly to their destination. A sturdy rope is threaded through a steel eyelet that rises about two feet above the bow of the boat. The captain's muscles strain with each heave-ho on the rope, as the boat cleaves through the deep waters of the river. A thick mist circles about the river and the boat as it very slowly is pulled across the river.  A wooden railing and an exit are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

Feldspar looks like a 4'8" standard mature average boned, wirey-tough bodied Anthian.
He is lying down.
He has long, braided, fine golden blonde hair, with hazel eyes, and looks neat.
He appears to be distant right now.
He bears the mark of Elindale.
He can be attacked by other players.
He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

Physical appearance:

Before you stands a graceful avian being with deep-set eyes that seem to look everywhere and nowhere at the same time. He returns your gaze calmly, fanning his wings softly.

>[Riverside.]

The footbridge that once connected this path to its match on the other side of the overflowing rushing river is now nothing more then a few charred pilings. Tiny insects buzz around their remains, finding a comfortable new home. Lashed to the remains of one of the more sturdy pilings is a tall steel pole. Wrapped around the pole, and tied securely is a taut rope. Bobbing ever so lightly due to the strain of the riverboat, the rope holds tight.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, and a riverboat are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south.
>

>[Brambles.]

[East Trade Road.]

A small orb of light hovers in the center of the path before you, only to disappear as you near it, reappearing further away into the swamp. Stepping near the orb to investigate closer only causes it to again blink out of existence, forming once more, deeper into the mists. It soon becomes apparent that the mysterious lights are attempting to slyly lead you into the swamp. To or for what purpose, is the question.

nw
sw
Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.
