Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south*.
go gate
>[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open stone gate, a wooden sign, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

nw
n
>[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
n
[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.
ne
[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
n
[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.
[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.
[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
put sp in he
>You have no "sp" in your inventory!
go gate
>[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
n
n
>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
n
n
n
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
l n
>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a dead grey mouse, a short iron dirk, and a short iron dirk are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st black cat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian (holding a glowing blue crystal orb of Sa), Treyfalgar the Noble San Elf, Sindelle the San Elf, Reilk the Noble Flerian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Caylith the Drake, Sull the San Elf, Forsythia the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Visandon the Thugian, Methoss the Drag-al, and Teef the Noble Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a dead grey mouse, a short iron dirk, and a short iron dirk are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st black cat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Lurker the Drake, Caylith the Drake, Feldspar the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above you), Forsythia the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, and Teef the Noble Human.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, an empty small vial of madness cure, an empty bottle of viscous black ichor, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a dead grey mouse, a short iron dirk, and a short iron dirk are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st flying squirrel (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st black cat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Lurker the Drake, Caylith the Drake, Feldspar the Noble Anthian (flying 20 feet above you), Forsythia the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, and Teef the Noble Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. [Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian (holding a glowing coiled turquoise sleeping dragon), Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.

[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian (holding a glowing coiled turquoise sleeping dragon), Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Forsythia west...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  A closed tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Forsythia southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

The eagle cocks it's head to peer at you with one golden raptor eye.

You follow Forsythia southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Forsythia southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Forsythia southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.

[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. A multi-colored stained glass window peers watchful from the crafty western building.  A rotting oak sign, a closed ugly rotting door, and a street lantern are here.

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. A mysterious gothic structure rises from what was once scattered remains of an alchemy shop. [Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. [Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a SIGN, and a street lantern are here.

[Rehas Way.]

Named after the first merchant to travel to Spur and set up shop, this road is now home to many of the Spur's finest merchants. Beautifully crafted wrought iron street lanterns line the avenue, brightening even the drabbest of days. A large stone building stands to the north of the road, intricate glowing runes adorn its entrance.   An open rune-inscribed moonsilver door, a gilded steelwood sign, and a street lantern are here.

[Rehas Way.]

Rehas Way continues on next to the high city wall above you. Every now and then, a guardsmen looks down, checking for magick users up to no good. Rich merchants are always relocating to this area to sell their fine and exotic wares.  An open steel banded oak door, a finely engraved gold plaque, and a street lantern are here.

[Rehas Way.]

Growing up the large Spurian Wall is a a beautiful carpet of ivy. Running along the base of the wall are several large carefully tended rose bushes. Opposite the wall is a beautiful oak building with a fresh coating of paint and several large stained glass windows. A crimson banner is draped over the doorway that reads "Grand Opening."  A pair of closed intricate oak double doors and a street lantern are here.

[Rehas Way.]

The old temple that was here has been refurbished and now has a broad banner exclaiming "Gruggle's Emporium!"  Blue and red streamers cascade down from the pillars and a broad red carpet covers the steps of the building. Strange noises emanate from the interior of Gruggle's place. His ability to capture and tame even the most wild of animals is world renowned. The fact that many give wide berth around his doorway convinces any casual observer that Spurians are still not very confident in his capabilities.  A giant wooden arch and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Rehas Way.]

A long-bearded Hithual carefully directs an eclectic group of workers in the building of a new shop. His calm voice points out those errors that would keep this building from being up to his high standards. Quality must be assured by this stout architect. The workers each take turns sitting beneath a large oak tree, a welcome relief from their hard work. A small sign next to the door proudly proclaims, "Pierini's Gems".  A beautiful large oak tree, a street lantern, and an open lacquered silver maple door are here.

[Rehas Way.]

Built as a "home away from home," this building is an outlet of the famous Sigrid's Place in Saldaea. The small yard in front has carefully trimmed grass, surrounded by a low hedge. Small stepping stones bisect the yard leading you to a grand door bearing the signature "Crossed Swords." Traffic is heavy along this portion of Rehas Way. Even though it is a rare occurrence to find Sigrid or her Uncle Reyranald in attendance, when they are the line can quickly build around the block for a chance to purchase a weapon from them.  An open green steelwood door and a street lantern are here.

[Rehas Way.]

City guards lean over the walls above watching all who pass into the area. Some are stationed to help protect the interests of the traveling merchants, others to keep an eye on rogues. [Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. [Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean. [West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. [West Spur Road.]

This merchant road stretches southeasterly towards Spur and northerly towards distant mountain ranges and unknown lands beyond them. Travelers speak of many dangers to the north, and people heading that way must trust in their luck and skills.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st ork.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north northeast southeast* southwest.
[West Spur Road.]

This merchant road stretches southeasterly towards Spur and northerly towards distant mountain ranges and unknown lands beyond them. Travelers speak of many dangers to the north, and people heading that way must trust in their luck and skills.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st ork.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north northeast southeast southwest.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The city of Spur looms on the eastern horizon, just beyond a wooded grove. A small path exits the grove and heads off to the northwest. The grass that lines the path ripples as a light breeze dances through its tall blades.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north east south*.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A dark foreboding forest is visible far off to the west. No grass grows near the forest. The grasslands shrink away from the grove as if even the plant life is afraid of it. There is a barren area between where the grass ends and the trees begin, giving the forest the illusion of isolation.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast south* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A dark twisted forest lies to the west, breaking the tranquil feel of the grasslands. The trees that are visible are twisted and deformed, the ground is scorched and blackened. A heavy ground fog seeps from deep within the forest carrying with it the acrid smell of death. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southeast*.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

To the southwest the ghostly outline of a forest can be seen darkening the area around it like a blight upon the land. Grassy plains stretch out to the west. Swarms of tiny insects hover just above the grass, in some places the swarms are so dense they take on the appearance of being a single entity.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

Ceresina climbs 10 feet.
[West Spur Road.]

To the southwest the ghostly outline of a forest can be seen darkening the area around it like a blight upon the land. Grassy plains stretch out to the west. Swarms of tiny insects hover just above the grass, in some places the swarms are so dense they take on the appearance of being a single entity.

You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Farm animals graze in the distance. Their vague forms barely visible as they lumber about the tall grass. To the north the flat grassland gives way to the rolling foothills of the Great Divide. The mountains themselves are nothing more than ghostly images fading in and out of view on the horizon.   

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A muddy pool of water lies to the north, nothing can be seen below its murky surface. The smell of rotting flesh rises from the pool and is carried for a great distance by the wind. The skeletal remains of what was once a cow lies half submerged in the water, its carcass picked clean by scavengers. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

[West Spur Road.]

The air is still and quiet except for the sound of a single cricket chirping away furiously to the left of the path. To the northwest the grasslands give way to a thorny bramble thicket that, in places, engulfs the road.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Thick brambles grow high and deep along both sides of the road. Sharp dagger-like thorns ready to welcome anyone unlucky enough to wander off the path. Small ragged pieces of cloth decorate the sharp thorns where some foolish travelers thought they could take a short cut.

This area is illuminated.

Thick thorny brambles line the path, as a further reminder to travelers that straying from their heading may be unwise. The road looks poorly tended in places, most notably where the brambles have spread beyond its outer boundaries.

[West Spur Road.]

Thorny vines reach out across the path making travel difficult. The thicket has become so overgrown that it is nearly impassable in places. The ground is worn by the soles of countless feet, making the dense wall of bramble seem even more out of place.

To the southeast the road disappears into a dense patch of thorny brambles. A burned out cart lies battered in a ditch at the side of the road. The cart bears the markings of the city of Rathan as well as those of the Rathene merchants guild.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A small clearing in the grass has been formed inside a cluster of large blackened rocks. The centerpiece to this well used rest area is a fire pit filled with charred wood and ash. Though the fire has burned out it still gives off a small amount of heat, suggesting it was used recently.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

Patches of dandelions grow randomly about the roadside. Occasionally a breeze picks up and scatters their fluffy white pollen about the countryside, furthering the dandelions goal to cover every square inch of the grasslands.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A crumbling arch lies off the path to the east. It stands as the last reminder of an inn that once offered solace to the weary that traveled this path. It can be discerned from the blackened color of the arch that the inn was the unfortunate victim of a fire.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The Silver River cuts through the grassland and heads southeast towards Spur. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the of city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The western bank of the Silver River is composed of ankle-deep mud and slime the river washed upon the shore. A fish, that was unlucky enough to be swept ashore, flops itself about desperately trying to get back to the sanctuary of the water.

[West Spur Road.]

The path is muddy and in some places the murky water is knee-deep. The Silver River is constantly overflowing as the muddy path clearly points out. The shape of a bridge crossing the river can be made out just in the distance to the northwest.

The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the Silver River. The river rushes past where the remains of the past bridge fill the water below. A fine misty spray splashes up and hits the jagged stone fragments.

[Northern Crossing.]

The bridge was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass under it. Its  height allows for a splendid view of the countryside, from Spur to the southeast, to the majestic peaks of the Great Divide.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The river surges strongly below you. Even from this height the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to pass between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

Extremely sturdy, though quickly rebuilt, the magnificent bridge spans across the mighty Silver River. Banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge, marking its reopening. Small gaps in the mortar are visible where the workers quickly pieced the stones together.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.
[Northern Crossing.]

Extremely sturdy, though quickly rebuilt, the magnificent bridge spans across the mighty Silver River. Banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge, marking its reopening. Small gaps in the mortar are visible where the workers quickly pieced the stones together.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

An osprey soars above the raging Silver River, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off on the western horizon.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[Northern Crossing.]

The massive stone bridge spans the mighty Silver River. The torrent of the river below rushes past the remains of the old bridge, carrying away bits of debris. Once heaping piles of building materials, now greatly dwindled lie discarded beside the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south* northwest.

You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The outline of a tall stone bridge can be made out to the southwest. The sound of flowing water roars loudly from that direction as well. Grassland is all that the eye can see in the immediate area to the northwest. Though the Great Divide is visible in the distance, its massive snow-covered peaks extending to the heavens, making everything else seem small in comparison. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Overflow from the nearby Silver River has turned much of the surrounding land into a muddy bog. Knee-deep and ice cold, the thick muddy water obscures the path from view. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* west.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Small patches of solid ground lie hidden by murky, leech-infested water. The ground beneath the surface of the bog is uneven and has a tendency to drop off sharply without warning.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

The eagle screeches quietly.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Dead misshapen trees rise from the surface of the putrid water. Their ghostly forms claw up through the thick fog of foul-smelling marsh gas.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thin strip of solid ground cuts a precarious path through the center of the bog. Small bubbles of mud form just off the path, releasing noxious gasses as they burst. The mist thick cloud formed by the gas drops visibility to almost nothing.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A thick mist covers the ground, making it difficult to discern where solid footing lies. A large rock protrudes from the swampy water. Though shaped naturally, it could easily be mistaken for a dragon curled up in a comfortable sleep.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

The ground is moist and yielding. A thick layer of sludge covers everything in sight accompanied by a thin ground fog that recedes as it rolls toward the west, away from the swamp.

[North Bridge Trail.]

The air is thick with the foul odor of a nearby swamp. The ground, though firm, is damp and muddy. A thick fog clings to the ground to the east marking the spot where the swamp begins.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The countryside is an endless mass of swaying grass. Green, yellow and brown blades dance with the wind, the colors mingling together to paint a beautiful picture on nature's canvas.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The vast sea of green is marred by a large black blot. A perfect circle ten feet in diameter has been burned into the grass. Several smaller circles are located nearby.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Tall, wispy blades of grass sway in the gentle breeze. A lone tree stands out in the otherwise monotonous sea of green grass. The tall oak extends its branches over the path, offering shade and a place to rest for weary travellers.  An oak tree is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Two small bluebirds dart through the air. They take turns chasing each other, changing directions rapidly to avoid being caught. Eventually they tire of the game and fly off over the sea of grass.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Tall fields of grass cover the earth as far as the eye can see. The one exception is the travel-worn merchant road, which connects the city of Spur to the mountainous lands of the north. An occasional rustling can be heard just off the path as tiny creatures scurry about. 

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

A strong wind blows down from the mountains to the north. With it comes the chill of the snow-covered peaks of the Great Divide. There is nothing immediately visible that could offer shelter from the cold, biting wind.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The constant howl of cold wind from the northern cliffs beats down all but the hardiest life here. The frigid gale kicks up a cloud of debris and furiously swirls it around before displacing it several feet from its point of origin. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[North Bridge Trail.]

The howling wind resonates across the barren foothills. Little grows in this harsh environment; a sharp contrast to the lush grassy plain visible to the southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

As you look around, the tall trees almost entirely block your view.  Small animals scurry about your feet, looking for food.  In the distance you can barely make out rocky hills and green mountains.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Trees shade the twisting dirt road, keeping the air pleasantly cool. You catch glimpses of the mountaintops to the north through the occasional break in the trees.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Trees shade the twisting dirt road, keeping the air pleasantly cool. You catch glimpses of the mountaintops to the north through the occasional break in the trees.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: east northwest.
>
You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You almost trip over some of the loose stones scattered on the road here. A big boulder that was left here by the roadbuilders blocks much of the road. The surroundings area is lightly forested, and you hear sounds from the shadows.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.

>
You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You continue down your path, keeping the mountains in sight.  Wagon tracks lead northeast, along the road.  You hear the chittering and chirping of the wildlife in the trees all around you.  Animals crawl into their homes of logs at the roadside.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southwest*.

>
You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road continues to the north and the south here.  All around you hear woodland animals making their normal noises.  This, combined with the spotted shadows on the road, provides a peaceful, yet eerie setting.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

Obvious paths: north southwest.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The trees here flourish as if they were blessed by Elindale herself. The whole area teems with wildlife. The forest seems to open into a small clearing towards the south.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

Obvious paths: northeast south.
>
You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The path curves slightly to the east as you continue north. A large tree threatens to fall right in front of you.  Thinking it will stay up long enough for you to pass, you quickly walk underneath it. An owl sits on a branch, watching your every move.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The quality of this road is unsurpassed by any you have seen anywhere else.  The workers must have spent long, hard hours on all the fine, detailed work.  The southern part of the road is decorated with gold, which gently blends with jade towards the northeast.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You chuckle a little as you see this section of the road. The builders had their bit of fun here, bringing in colorful stones to form a mosaic under your feet. The picture depicts a grinning troll's face that seems to wink at you as you stride across it. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A large milestone stands prominently by the roadside. It must have been a dazzling sight in better times, but thieves have long since pried loose the inlaid gems from its surface. All that remains are small holes and scrape marks.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The surface of the road has been compacted by all the animals and merchants traveling across it. The occasional guard still patrols here, trying to keep the area safe for merchants and travelers.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st troll and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

>
You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road twists around several big trees that even Oliphants couldn't drag out of the way. By the roadside, you see some unfortunate travelers who have been robbed of everything they had when they started their journey.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The loud screeching here hurts your ears. Huge birds swoop down as if to strike you, and many of their young peer down from above to examine you. You feel running, or at least hiding, would be a very good idea now.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The odd screeching continues, and almost causes you to break down and stop. The bones all around you serve as unpleasant reminders that you shouldn't stay here too long.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The sun shines brightly here during the day, and you see many bunnies and harmless creatures in the area. The surroundings radiate a feeling of peacefulness, enticing you to lay down your equipment and take a short break before returning to your journey.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The forest on either side of the road seems to be closing in on you.  The road curves to the west and southeast here.  Squirrels and chipmunks scurry across the rocky path.  The green of the mountains is concealed by the treetops.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: southeast* west.

You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You find yourself climbing one of the few steep hills in this forest. The road rises at a sharp angle, but the passage is still fairly easy. You hear soft growling in the distance, and decide to move onward.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

From all appearances, it looks like the road builders should have gone straight north, yet they didn't. It's almost as if they were blocked by something. The clump of trees to the north seems very thick, but that shouldn't have stopped determined builders. As you puzzle over the matter, you think you hear something calling you. You shake your head and move on.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[North Bridge Trail.]

This part of the road is covered with rocks and pebbles, making it a rough stretch for the barefooted to cross. Bushes and small trees push their way onto the road from the roadsides.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

To the north lies the road and the mountains.  Southwest will bring you back to civilization.  The beautiful scenery on either side of the path adds some color to the otherwise lifeless road ahead. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The mountains seem to plunge out of the trees and into the sky ahead of you, and the road seems to split the sea of trees.  The road leads towards the mountains northwest, and away to the south.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

>
You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Looking around, you notice two large birds circling overhead.  You hear a noise, but when you look, nothing is there.  An occasional rodent runs in front of you.  You see the mountaintops getting closer as you head north.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

>
You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

More strange noises flood your mind.  They are not completely unfamiliar, yet you find that you are unable to place them.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: north southeast.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Large muddy puddles cover the road ahead of you. They leave you feeling grimy and soaked as you trek through them, but after the long distance you've traveled, you hardly care anymore. The light fog here seems to thicken towards the north.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Large muddy puddles cover the road ahead of you. They leave you feeling grimy and soaked as you trek through them, but after the long distance you've traveled, you hardly care anymore. The light fog here seems to thicken towards the north.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road continues in a straight path, with the mountains directly ahead.  The forest around the road here has very little vegetation besides the trees.  You can see quite far into the woods.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

The road continues in a straight path, with the mountains directly ahead.  The forest around the road here has very little vegetation besides the trees.  You can see quite far into the woods.

Obvious paths: north south.
>
You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A beggar lies here asking you to kindly spare him some food. By the looks of him, he hasn't shaved in months, and the smell of Dragon Ale hangs heavy in the air around him. Some stop and share a few silver with him, but most just wander past ignoring his loud request.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south* northwest.

Caylith rumbles to Raptorian.

You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Trees surround you in all directions. The underbrush has been cleared out to form small passages leading northwest and southeast. The large trees inspire awe, most of them must be centuries old.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You find yourself standing on the brink of a large cliff. A large landslide has cleared the trees from the area, exposing the soil to erosion. You trip over some of the loose rubble and are almost sent plunging down into oblivion before you manage to catch yourself.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southeast*.

You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Even though it is bright here you think you see little shadowy shapes scurrying about.  You quickly turn your head and they are gone.  Out of the corner of your eye you see them again, but as you turn towards them, they vanish.  You notice something strange lurking here.  

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

You follow Forsythia north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A variety of strange markings cover the ground, most of them are unlike anything you have ever seen before. An experienced and well traveled forester might have some hope of identifying the creatures that made them, but the task is beyond your capabilities. Smoke billows out of the woods to the north, and you wonder what lies there.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A large house made of wood, logs, bark and other forest materials stands prominently in the middle of this small clearing. A small graveyard with many gravemarkers lies next to the house. Much of the ground in the graveyard has been upturned, and you feel you'd rather not know why.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Large bloodstains mark the surrounding trees and roadsides. There must have been a terrific struggle here, and you pray that you don't meet the villain that was responsible. To the south, you see a plume of smoke billowing from amidst the trees.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

To the northwest, the forest spreads out and becomes more sparse. The strange noises and smells seem to creep back into the deeper areas of the forest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road becomes much more rugged and rocky to the north, while a large expanse of forests covers the landscape to the south. The twists and turns in the road make it impossible to see far ahead. You grow apprehensive as you realize that the terrain is perfect for ambushes.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

You find yourself in a lightly forested area, between the vast forests to the south and the rockier terrain to the northeast. The path is quite rocky, making traveling harder.

[Tarath Bends.]

Stone fragments litter the seemingly well traveled paths. You hear the faint trickling of a stream in the distance, and occasionally you make out the sounds of some mountain animal.

The path takes a sharp curve here, and the sharp rocks under your feet make the journey hard on your feet. The path appears to be fairly well traveled, although you would hardly consider it safe.  A freshly uncovered crevice is here.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path winds on. Voices of other travelers echo from far above, but the mountainside keeps you from seeing the road section they are on. It's hard to judge how long your remaining journey is.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path curves back and forth in a very consistent and repetitive manner. The mountain air would be very refreshing, if it weren't for the lizardman overtones hanging in the air.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path begins to straighten here, but up ahead you can see that it goes back to its twisting full force. Chips of limestone and other rock can be seen scattered all over the path.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

Linneastrylon's glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa flickers for a moment.

The eagle cocks it's head to peer at you with one golden raptor eye.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path begins to straighten here, but up ahead you can see that it goes back to its twisting full force. Chips of limestone and other rock can be seen scattered all over the path.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Forsythia east...

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A small stream runs across the path here. Some sticks have been laid across the streambed to act as a crude bridge, although they seem rickety at best. You feel it's safest to just jump across the stream.

[Tarath Bends.]

The raw earth has been torn apart revealing a jagged crevice to the northwest. The floor of the crevice is littered with debris and slopes down into darkness. The crumbling edge of the east-west trail barely skirts the opening.

This area is illuminated.

>
You follow Forsythia northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Crumbling Fissure.]

The earth's upheaval has created this long and narrow fissure. The bottom of the gap is strewn with broken rock and the air hangs heavy with dust. Towering above you, the precarious walls shudder and occasionally drop a smattering of debris at your feet. 

This area is illuminated.

You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: southeast west.
>
You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The earth trembles as the newly formed landslide continues to settle. Small rocks and other debris tumble from the top and sides of the formation. The landslide rises, insurmountable to the east and southwest, however from this point one could traverse the peak to the other side.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

Walking along the bottom of a valley between the hills and the mountains, you see the mountains to the north that rise majestically out of the earth. A track weaves and twists up the mountain side from here.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

What once was the intersection of two roads is now a single road paralleled by a massive amount of rock, mud and timber. A new landslide covers the older settled debris making passage to the northeast impossible. Rocks and pebbles lay across the path making movement precarious. The new landslide still groans and shifts ever so slightly.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st caravan guard, the 2nd caravan guard, the 3rd caravan guard, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Tarath Bends.]

Piles of rubble flank the road on both sides. Some new and some old, this rubble is a mixture of two guard towers and this side of the mountain. High above, the jagged peak of the small mountain thrusts itself out over the road, ready to collapse under the right circumstances. A new rent has been cut into the southeastern side of the mountain, allowing passage to the southern road.

Northward the rolling grasslands rise up to meet a towering cliff face that rises into the clear alpine air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast west.
>

You follow Forsythia northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A massive rent opens up between the mountain side heading south. Boulders sit precariously on the mountain side ready to fall to the ground. Many tons of earth have shifted from the face of the mountain to the ground, covering the small growth of forest at its base. The southeastern road is totally blocked with rubble.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 15 feet above you).

[Tarath Gorge.]

As you round the last bend your breath is taken away by the sheer length, width, and depth of the gorge that lies ahead. The area is scarred as if from mining, you notice small pieces of silver scattered about the area.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

As you continue you notice that the granite in this area has been deeply mined. Large granite boulders have been literally yanked from this gorge to reveal the ore that sat for centuries deep inside the earth.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A wide rocky trail heads off into the mountainous terrain in an easterly direction. A large pile of rocks from an old landslide partially blocks passage in the other direction. Cracks and crevasses mar trail's surface, as runoff from the mountain snow makes its way to lower ground. Lush green bushes, and small trees dot the landscape, mingling with large boulders and smaller rocks.  A large pile of rocks is here.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A strong breeze blows off the mountains of the Great Divide. It both slows your climb and encourages your decent into the valley. The brush and trees lean noticeably towards the east, as if it was easier for them to just grow in the direction of the wind then to try and fight their natural instinct of reaching to the sun.

This area is illuminated.

[Tarath Bends.]

A large rotted tree lies directly in your path. The trail swerves around the stump, forcing all carts and travelers to fit between a large rock and the upraised roots. Scrapes and scratches on the rock leads one to believe that not every cart has fit through here comfortably.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The trail winds around the large fallen tree. Smaller saplings, and fungus grows in the soil that is being enriched by the decaying tree. Several rocks dot the newly carved trail around the tree, making travel difficult. It is fairly certain many have cursed the falling of this great tree, and subsequent detour.

[Tarath Bends.]

A small birds nest has been built within one of the larger cracks of the great tree. Twittering, chirping and the occasional rustling is quite noticeable from the nest as the babies all vie for whatever sustenance their parent brings. A quick flash red and mother bird flies off to find more worms.

A makeshift path has been created to circumvent the large tree that has fallen down and blocked the regular path. Lying on its side, the log stands two heads higher then the tallest Thugian. l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A carpet of needles covers the path. Pine cones, larger then a Thugian fist, dot the ground. Enormous trees collide with large boulders blocking you from venturing too deep into the overgrown wood. The squawk of a large bird echoes from far overhead, but looking up to identify it would be futile, as it perches in branches hundreds of feet above your head.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west*.
[Tarath Bends.]

A carpet of needles covers the path. Pine cones, larger then a Thugian fist, dot the ground. Enormous trees collide with large boulders blocking you from venturing too deep into the overgrown wood. The squawk of a large bird echoes from far overhead, but looking up to identify it would be futile, as it perches in branches hundreds of feet above your head.
