Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Forsythia east...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Only the hardiest of life forms hold their own on the rocky steppes. Small cascades of icy water stream down the boulders and darken their surfaces. Tough lichen and scrub pines absorb nutrients from the mineral laden run-off. The sun shines brightly on the southern exposure of the trail, sheltered from the wind and freezing cold. Bright green oases of life sprout from rocky niches and the path is slippery where the green slimy growths cross it.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
[Tarath Bends.]

>
You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Thin ribbons of different colored gravel and debris fan out in the valley far below, terminating in great piles. Dark hues of maroon, purple and gray striate the great runs of rock, mingling with occasional drifts of glowing snow and tangles of dead trees.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east northwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]

Obvious paths: east northwest.
>
You follow Forsythia east...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The pitch of the path is precarious for carts and wheeled vehicles. The splintered wood from unfortunate wheels and spokes gathers in the cracks and crags by the side of the path. Brightly colored bits of metal and smashed pieces of iron plating stand out in contrast against the sparkling granite.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

>
You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The stark terrain is impressive in its scope and austerity. One cannot help but feel insignificant and temporary amid the expanse of granite and limestone formed through the millennia. Washed by rain, scorched by the sun and frozen by storms, the rocks endure, a testament to the strength of the Great Divide.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south northwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]

Obvious paths: south northwest.
>
You follow Forsythia south...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path widens and follows a small curve into the valley. Rainwater has pooled along the side of a large boulder. Small animals and insects are drawn to it but suddenly dart away at any sudden noise.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southeast.

>
You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path leads downward is sheltered from the howling wind, rain and relentless sun by steep walls of granite. Animal tracks are barely visible in what little dust lies on the rough surface of the rock. A quiet calm descends momentarily on the sheltered walkway.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south northwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path leads downward is sheltered from the howling wind, rain and relentless sun by steep walls of granite. Animal tracks are barely visible in what little dust lies on the rough surface of the rock. A quiet calm descends momentarily on the sheltered walkway.

Obvious paths: south northwest.
>
You follow Forsythia south...


l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

Huge boulders have created a bowl shaped depression in this sheltered hillock. A stand of scruffy trees continues to eke out a tenuous existence above the rocky outpost; their long tortured roots clinging desperately to what little soil is caught between the boulders. Prevailing winds from the mountaintop have caused the trunks to lean westward, the upper branches creating a canopy over the area.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southeast.
[Traveler's Camp.]

Raptorian asks, "Can we stop at the fort?  I didn't get to renew cause I was daydreaming."

You follow Forsythia southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

Beneath the trees, many a caravan has stopped to water their draft animals and rest for the night. The area is strewn with animal refuse, bits of feed, and the resulting lingering aroma. The discarded feed and rubbish left by the travelers is picked over constantly by the hillock's inhabitants. In such a harsh environment, very little waste is left by the local scavengers.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south northwest*.

>
Caylith asks, "Can we stop at the runeshop in Tarath?"

You follow Forsythia south...


l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

A small spring fed stream meanders around the bowl, filling a pool on the western side of the path. A series of miniature waterfalls gurgle delightfully along the edges of the camp. The resulting pool is quite deep and crystal clear, even with the constant watering of pack animals. The flow of the spring must be constantly replenishing the pool, for no algae or slime clouds its depths.  A small crystal clear pool is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The wide path heads towards the west. The landscape is dotted with unusually large trees and boulders. An attempt to head to the west is futile, as one of these large giant trees has fallen over and blocked the normal route.   A giant fallen tree is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A makeshift path has been created to circumvent the large tree that has fallen down and blocked the regular path. Lying on its side, the log stands two heads higher then the tallest Thugian. Its leafy top continues to grow, as if the fact that the roots are no longer bound to the ground makes no difference at all.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* west.
[Tarath Bends.]

A makeshift path has been created to circumvent the large tree that has fallen down and blocked the regular path. Lying on its side, the log stands two heads higher then the tallest Thugian. Its leafy top continues to grow, as if the fact that the roots are no longer bound to the ground makes no difference at all.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast west.
>
You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Branches that were once the top of this enormous tree clutter the makeshift path. Their leaves continuing to grow up and out, even after what must have been many years since the toppling of this giant wonder.  Some large leafy tree branches are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A small birds nest has been built within one of the larger cracks of the great tree. Twittering, chirping and the occasional rustling is quite noticeable from the nest as the babies all vie for whatever sustenance their parent brings. A quick flash red and mother bird flies off to find more worms.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The trail winds around the large fallen tree. Smaller saplings, and fungus grows in the soil that is being enriched by the decaying tree. Several rocks dot the newly carved trail around the tree, making travel difficult. It is fairly certain many have cursed the falling of this great tree, and subsequent detour.

[Tarath Bends.]

A large rotted tree lies directly in your path. The trail swerves around the stump, forcing all carts and travelers to fit between a large rock and the upraised roots. Scrapes and scratches on the rock leads one to believe that not every cart has fit through here comfortably.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A strong breeze blows off the mountains of the Great Divide. It both slows your climb and encourages your decent into the valley. The brush and trees lean noticeably towards the east, as if it was easier for them to just grow in the direction of the wind then to try and fight their natural instinct of reaching to the sun.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A wide rocky trail heads off into the mountainous terrain in an easterly direction. A large pile of rocks from an old landslide partially blocks passage in the other direction. Cracks and crevasses mar trail's surface, as runoff from the mountain snow makes its way to lower ground. Lush green bushes, and small trees dot the landscape, mingling with large boulders and smaller rocks.  A large pile of rocks is here.

[Tarath Gorge.]

Rough granite walls rise above you to the east and west. The area here is a bit rougher and seems to have been recently mined. Large veins of silver can be seen. Up overhead, on the western face of the gorge wall a large crack has appeared. Though large enough to fit a Thugian, the only thing exiting the crack is a steady stream of dripping water.

The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

You stand before a granite wall and large double gated doors. The walls are thick and finely crafted, and there seems to be a rather aged look about them.  The Gate is made of massive slabs of silver, while off to the left and right are the fort's impressive walls, able to withstand a rather large invasion or army if need be.  An open silver-trimmed black drathain gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Fort Tarath.]

The giant fortification wall is divided into two main sections by huge doors.  These doors have been made from silver and look as though they could stand even the most fearsome battering ram.  Guards standing atop the walls eye you closely.  To the north you can see the business district.  An open silver-trimmed black drathain gate is here.

[Fort Tarath.]

Each corner of this square gives entrance to one of the fort's four business establishments. The bank is small, but adequate. The pawnshop and store will see to your buying and selling needs, and the Tarath Wayside Inn is open at all hours to provide shelter for residents and foreigners alike.

[Tarath Gorge and The Silver Strand.]

The gorge continues onward as far as the eye can see while a newly excavated road opens up northwest. Black soot and ash, along with grey flecked dust has settled on everything in the area. A cool breeze rushes in from the new roadway, blowing with it the scent of moist air.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

This newly constructed road begins the climb to the mountain peaks as a vein from the main Rathan-Fort Tarath artery. Following the steep incline of the mountain's side, this twisting path travels its way to the opposite side of the City of Rathan. High above in that part of the mountain, a single silver-spired tower peaks through the misty mountain air and glistens slightly.

[The Silver Strand.]

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A huge boulder, imbedded within the side of the mountain, partially blocks the road. The boulders face is black and sooty, but no form of blasting seems to have made a dent. The roads direction was obviously changed to reflect this small problem.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Small birds fly high overhead, circling this part of the road. The span from the edge of the road to the southern mountain face is not very far, however the drop into the valley would be suicide. On that mountain side a small cave yawns its opening next to a narrow ledge. Perhaps one could jump down to it without falling to their death...

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The air has become thin and cold making travel more difficult. Black and grey stone dust blows to and fro along the road and over the edge into the valley below. Small pebbles tumble down from above announcing the presence of something higher up.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A small crack in the road spills forth a small stream of dirty brown water. Nearer the road edge, close to the drop down the mountain side, the erosion is terrible. In time, if the flow of water continues, the road may wash away without much of a trace.

This area is illuminated.

[The Silver Strand.]

Misty clouds hang close to the mountain side, partially covering the road and making traveling dangerous. In some spots the mist is so thick, the edge of the road is hidden from view. Caution is needed when traveling this path.

[The Silver Strand.]

The side of the mountain rises up to meet with the roadway higher on the mountain. Damp and cold air mixes with the warm breeze from down below making small clouds appear here and there.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A stumble or trip would send anyone falling headlong, over the edge of the road and down, down onto the broken rocks far below. Wind whips around the corner from the southwest, blowing dust and debris into the air. Small loose rocks line the pathway making each step a dangerous course of action.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The mountains of the Great Divide stretch to the north and west as far as the eyes can see. Snow tipped peaks glisten in the daylight hours and sparkle under the stars at night. Large clouds hang above the peaks moving in the upper currents.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Far upward and northwest a massive tower stands near the peak of the mountain. Massive clouds float at its base blocking whatever route to the tower from view. The towers single spire gleams brightly, the silver polished heavily. Not much more can be assertained about the tower from this position.

[The Silver Strand.]

The roadway is wet and moldy. Small puddles of water cover the floor, some bubbling hotly, their steam rising into the air. Greenish mold surrounds most of the puddles and lines the base of the mountain where the road butts up against it.

The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The road underfoot is black and marred, its surface covered with sticky soot and ash. A large water stain stretches from a hole high over head, down the eastern mountain face, and over the road edge to the area below. A few brackish puddles stand on the roads surface, smelling strangely like animal waste.

[The Silver Strand.]

The road has changed from grey stone and dirt to a reddish clay. Different layers of soil show through the mountain wall. Even a narrow strip of silver travels across the mountains face and follows the road as it inclines.

l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

Another massive boulder, black and melted, blocks any further passage toward the top of the mountain. Thick grey and white clouds hang heavily near the edge of the road, swirling ever so slightly in the breeze. There is no way to continue up the mountain except perhaps by climbing the sheer cliff wall. The clouds pulse slightly and gravitate toward the road surface, the sound of thunder rolling over the area. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia through some white billowy clouds...


l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

A ribbon of pure silver stretches out through the billowing clouds toward the peak of the mountain. Each step is like walking on soft carpeting but without any solid underfooting to hold one up. Any movement on the silver strand makes the surface flow like the waves on the ocean, rippling into the distance.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand twists and stretches and in some parts is not entirely there. Large holes open and close on its surface but without fail passage over these rifts is made without any problems. Above and surrounding the strand, the billowing clouds make up the walls of a silky tunnel, flickering with light and the sounds of rolling thunder every so often. The tunnel leads east to a solid mountain roadway and west into a blur.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

>
You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[The Silver Strand.]

The strand and tunnel end abruptly before you, dispersing in the strong wind that blows down from the mountain. The next steps will have you hundreds of feet above the mountain base, standing on nothing but air, all solid footing gone. Across this long gap, on its otherside, the silver strand and the cloud tunnel begin again, making their way toward the mountain tower.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west.

You follow Forsythia west...


l
The area brightens.
[Sky.]

There is nothing here but the open expanse of sky. A silvery walkway ends quite close to the east, its semi-solid footing welcome to most who cannot fly. Far northeast another part of the strand waits for a traveler to set foot on its surface to continue the journey up the mountain. A strong wind blows down from the mountain peak, attempting to bring the massive drop to the ground quickly and painfully to anyone stupid enough to wander out into the sky.  A fiery gate in the sky is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast east*.

>
You follow Forsythia through a fiery gate in the sky...


l
The area brightens.
[Phoenix Gate.]

You stand upon a small island floating amoungst the clouds. Glowing purple crystal formations stand to each of the cardinal directions of the island's perimeter. At the heart of the area is a swirling sphere of golden flame. Wisps of flame trail from the sphere and dance through the air.  A fiery gateway is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious exits: None.
[Phoenix Gate.]

You stand upon a small island floating amoungst the clouds. Glowing purple crystal formations stand to each of the cardinal directions of the island's perimeter. At the heart of the area is a swirling sphere of golden flame. Wisps of flame trail from the sphere and dance through the air.  A fiery gateway is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious exits: None.
>
You follow Forsythia through a fiery gateway...


l
The area brightens.
[Temple of Rinanni, Courtyard.]

A cobblestone path winds its way through a beautiful garden of multicolored flowers, arched trellises, and weeping willow trees. The path ends at the entrance to the glimmering Temple of Rinanni. The glorious structure, constructed out of pure white marble and lustrous purple crystal, rises many stories and radiates a luminous violet glow. White and violet robed priests casually stroll up and down the small pathway.  An open ivy-covered wrought iron gate, a pair of open luminescent purple crystal doors, a small path under the willows, and a rose entwined wooden arbor are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: None.
[Temple of Rinanni, Courtyard.]

A cobblestone path winds its way through a beautiful garden of multicolored flowers, arched trellises, and weeping willow trees. The path ends at the entrance to the glimmering Temple of Rinanni. The glorious structure, constructed out of pure white marble and lustrous purple crystal, rises many stories and radiates a luminous violet glow. White and violet robed priests casually stroll up and down the small pathway.  An open ivy-covered wrought iron gate, a pair of open luminescent purple crystal doors, a small path under the willows, and a rose entwined wooden arbor are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: None.
>
You follow Forsythia through an open ivy-covered wrought iron gate...


l
The area brightens.
[Rear Palace Gateway.]

The smooth purple crystal of the rear palace wall is broken by a massive white marble archway set with a great silver gate, centered at the top of a wide flight of polished white marble stairs. Opposite the marble stairway and across the cobblestone pathway, another gate, this one of black wrought-iron, stands within the center of the fence which runs behind the garden. A thin purple ribbon has been tied to the gate, its satin arms rustling in the breeze.   An open ivy-covered wrought iron gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east west.

[Rear Garden Path.]

An aging silver willow droops its silky limbs to the ground. Thick greenish-yellow moss covers the ground beneath the shadowy trunk, while tiny annual flowers poke through the mulch covered garden floor. The scents of honeysuckle and roses float through the damp air whenever a low breeze plays through the area. Far overhead, on the opposite side of the Silver Mountain peak, a large silver-spired tower can be seen. 

This area is illuminated.

[Western Garden Lane.]

The area brightens.
[Rathan, The Great Gate.]

A pleasant breeze rustles the hardy pine trees which line this cobblestone street. A large establishment of deep purple crystal dwarfs the other structures, its silver spires reaching high overhead. Just beyond the elegant structure, the Silver Mountain provides a sense of safety. The street widens sharply to the east and west in a delta of smoother stone, either side trailed by a lawn of low-cut green grass. A polished white stairway leads up to a great silver gate, its body set within a massive carved archway which itself is centered within the crystal wall.  An announcement and an ornate silver gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

[Rathanus Road.]

A short distance ahead, giant silver gates bar passage to Rathan Palace. The pedicured lawn and expertly pruned topiaries blend well against the dark granite Palace walls. The plaza to the south bustles with activity as the citizens of Rathan barter loudly with some foreign merchants from a large trade caravan.

This area is illuminated.

[Rathanus Road.]

Rathanus Road is the main street of Rathan. Running directly from the city gates at the south end of the city and north through the central plaza where the roadway ends directly at the steps of a beautiful purple crystal palace. As one of the beautiful symbols of Rathan City, Rathanus road is kept in pristine condition, throughout every season.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

[Central Plaza North.]

A silvery paved road joins the plaza through a gilded silver gate and continues north toward the Rathene Royal Palace. Sculpted flowering topiaries and marble benches adorn the area. The haunting melody of a violin can be heard from an open window set in the large building to the side of the street. Every so often pairs of hand holding young lovers and elegantly dressed nobles with their package laden attendants will wander by.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia southeast...

[Central Plaza East.]

The broad edifice that is the Hall of Ministers towers over the eastern section of the plaza. Pillars of smooth marble, covered in vines of lush ivy, support the exterior of the majestic building. A wide flight of stairs leads to a pair of massive doors set within an intricately carved marble archway. Beautifully sculpted hedges and elegant flower arrangements adorn the small front lawn. Wealthy looking city officials, with scrolls and vellum documents in hand, quickly enter and exit the colossal structure.  An ivy-covered wrought iron fence and a pair of open massive silver-trimmed teak doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Forsythia south...

[Central Plaza Southeast.]

An immense stone building dominates the southeast corner of the plaza. A trail of black smoke rises from its giant chimney and the sound of hammers striking metal resonates throughout the area. A gilded sign, bearing the image of a suit of armor, hangs above the entrance.  An open silver-trimmed drathain door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia east...

[Rathan.]

A crew of broom-wielding Flerians have been put to work sweeping the street clean. Every so often one of them will stoop down and pick up a various bit of trash, smile widely and stuff the new "treasure" into their pocket. Preoccupied travelers make their way along this busy avenue, passing under the tall shade trees and talking softly. To the east, two buildings tower over the others, both sporting a large amount of traffic coming and going.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

You follow Forsythia east...

[Rathan.]

Aside from the main city plaza this part of the city is one of the busiest. Large groups of adventurers, travelers and city natives stand or mill about in front of two large buildings, stepping aside as people walk by. Most of the street-side windows are opened wide, framing breeze blown curtains or homeowners calling out to the avenue below. A light mountain breeze rustles the leaves overhead, the shady trees shifting slightly.  A steel banded oak door and a rune etched morbius door are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Rathan, Runeshop.]

A well kept runeshop is laid out in this large building. Several comfortable chairs reside along the wall, with an Archmage at each station ready to implant any runes needed. A soft spoken Usil Elf shows you inside and to the nearest available chair.  A rune etched morbius door is here.

[Central Plaza South.]

A group of traveling buskers have set up a small stage at the southern end of the plaza. The odd looking trio is made up of a tiny Human child playing a tambourine, a beautiful Fir Elf maiden playing a lute, and a Human man, with the largest nose you have ever seen, playing the fiddle. Breathtaking music, the likes of which you have never heard, fills the air as the trio dances around the stage. Groups of townsfolk applaud and toss silver coins into the large bucket at the base of the stage.  An open gilded silver gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Rathanus Road.]

Stately homes, with manicured lawns and ivy covered fences, rise along both sides of the road. The traffic upon the road is mostly made up of glittering silver horse drawn carriages, patrols of royal guards, and the occasional rickety farmer's wagon. The carriages pull into the entrances of expensive looking homes and depart as quickly as they came, carrying wealthy noblemen off to various locales around the city.  Some large wooden and stone houses, an ivy-covered wrought iron fence, and some wild Rathene roses are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Rathanus Road.]

Stately homes, with manicured lawns and ivy covered fences, rise along both sides of the road. The traffic upon the road is mostly made up of glittering silver horse drawn carriages, patrols of royal guards, and the occasional rickety farmer's wagon. The carriages pull into the entrances of expensive looking homes and depart as quickly as they came, carrying wealthy noblemen off to various locales around the city.  Some large wooden and stone houses, an ivy-covered wrought iron fence, and some wild Rathene roses are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.

[Rathanus Road & Treewort Avenue.]

A luxurious pine log building stands at the corner of Rathanus Road and Treewort Avenue. Colorful stained glass windows and ivy-covered balconies grace the exterior of the elegant structure. An ornate silver sign hangs above the entrance engraved with the image of a mug imposed over the outline of a mountain. Upon the sign are words etched in a flowing script which read, "The Silver Mountain Inn". Pleasant music and laughter originate from within.  A pair of closed artfully carved oak doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* east south west.

[Rathanus Road.]

The grand ivy covered buildings of the city of Rathan rise side by side along the road and increase in splendor further to the north. Large stained glass windows, silvery rooftops, and artfully crafted wood workings adorn the majestic structures. Townsfolk casually stroll down the silver paved streets, enjoying the crisp mountain air. The savory aroma of food roasting over a log fire drifts in from somewhere nearby.  Some wooden and stone buildings, an ivy-covered wrought iron fence, and some wild violet lilacs are here.

[Rathanus Road.]

A small, chilly-looking stream rushes briskly down the rocky terrain, and an ancient stone bridge provides passage across it. The bridge itself has been slightly eroded by time, but its demonic features are still quite visible. The pleasant moonflowers that bloom at its base provide a stark contrast to the bridge's sinister appeal.  An ancient demon-headed stone bridge, a flowing pale blue stream, and some glowing silvery moonflowers are here.

[Rathanus Road.]

The long silver paved road, named after the founding ruler of Rathan, continues along the Silver Mountain's southern slope. [City of Rathan, Main Gate.]

A wide silver paved road begins at the city's main gate and ascends toward the heart of Rathan. The scenic view of the city from this point is truly captivating. A multitude of silvery roofed buildings, surrounded by tall evergreen trees, rise along the Silver Mountain's southern slope. Far to the north, the snowcapped peak of the Silver Mountain rises above the glimmering crystal dome of the Rathene Royal Palace. City guards, merchants, and townsfolk continuously pass through the gate set in the outer wall to the south.  A giant carved granite wall, an open giant silver gate, and some glowing silvery moonflowers are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Raptorian the Noble Secian, Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing sparkling blue orb of Sa), Gwen the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, and Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

[Entry Passage.]

The open passageway serves as a buffer between the inner and outer gates of the city of Rathan. Giant stone towers, connected by wooden walkways overhead, stand to each side of the passage. Silvery clad archers patrol the ramparts above. In times of emergency the city's gates can be closed simultaneously to entrap invaders.  An open silver spiked drathain portcullis and an open giant silver gate are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Demon Slope.]

As you reach out to grasp a rock to help you turn the corner you notice your fingers have begun to turn blue as a result of the cold, thin air.  The ground here seems to be unstable and your footing is precarious.
